greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of the prime power divisors of n (not including 1).
link: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: G.f.: Sum_{k>=2} floor(1/omega(k))*k*x^k/(1 - x^k), where omega(k) is the number of distinct prime factors (A001221). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Jan 04 2017
a(n) = Sum_{d|n} d * [omega(d) = 1], where omega is the number of distinct prime factors and [ ] is the Iverson bracket. - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Jan 28 2021
program: (PARI) a(n) = sumdiv(n, d, if(isprimepower(d), d)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 21 2017; corrected by _Daniel Suteu_, Jul 20 2018
(PARI) a(n) = my(f = factor(n)); sum(k = 1, #f~, f[k, 1] * (f[k, 1]^f[k, 2] - 1) / (f[k, 1] - 1)) \\ _Daniel Suteu_, Jul 20 2018
results.author: _Olivier Gérard_
